Medford.Fowle-Reed-Wyman House: The Fowle-Reed-Wyman House is a historic First Period house at 64 Old Mystic Street in Arlington, Massachusetts. The house is a two-story wood frame saltbox structure with integral lean-to, central chimney, and clapboard siding. Built about 1706, it is the oldest structure in Arlington, and is the best-preserved of the three First Period houses left in the town.
